channel.title: Flaw in SCAR tags
channel.description:
A simple bug that I'm sure nobody would notic but I did so.... In the SCAR tags, comments are colored green. But the tags do not do this on all comment starters and stopers.
Example:
[scar] { Test Test }
// Test
(* This comment does not work *)
[/scar]
See, (* and *) and valid comment starter and stopers in SCAR (few people know that) yet they don't work in the SCAR tags.
Nothing really important, just I comment my scripts with (* and *). ;)

item.title: Flaw in SCAR tags
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

i never added (* support for comments in my obfuscator
i do support:
{

}
//
/*

*/

where hard enough for parsing.
not to mention threadsafe method calls wwhich include string witha refrence to the anme of the method! had to support those.

Read full topic

item.title: Flaw in SCAR tags
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:10305”](and the grey background is so ugly)

Yeah, should be fixed. Ever wonder why in scar, Integer is bolded but String isn’t?

[scar]
Program New;
Var
x : String;
y : Integer;
Begin
End.
[/scar]

Oh look same thing in the scar tags. Looks like the scar tags also emulated a scar syntax bug.[/quote]

String/string is bolded because there bolded in scar, as Integer/integer aren’t.

Bebemycat2:

See, (* and *) and valid comment starter and stopers in SCAR (few people know that) yet they don’t work in the SCAR tags.

Also, Bebe, when you say “(few people know that)”, I beleve I knew that before writing my first(very noobish :P) script. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Flaw in SCAR tags
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hyjall:

Actually, integer is a wrapper class, int is the primitive type (atleast, that’s the way it’s organised in java). And String is a class indeed (hence why it’s spelled with a capital S).

thats how it is in java, in pascal integer is a primitive type, Im just not sure what String is in pascal

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hyjall Hyjall
item.description:
@Hyjall wrote:

Actually, integer is a wrapper class, int is the primitive type (atleast, that’s the way it’s organised in java). And String is a class indeed (hence why it’s spelled with a capital S).

item.description:

could it be because integer is a type and string is a class?

item.title: Flaw in SCAR tags
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote author=Ron link=topic=15033.msg171507#msg171507 date=1156115047]
(and the grey background is so ugly)

Yeah, should be fixed. Ever wonder why in scar, Integer is bolded but String isn’t?

[quote]
You said it backwards by the way.

Actually String is the only variable that is bolded. I think it has something to do with the program it was made it, but I never coded Delphi, so I’m not excactly sure.

Read full topic

@Bebemycat2 wrote:

A simple bug that I’m sure nobody would notic but I did so…
In the SCAR tags, comments are colored green. But the tags do not do this on all comment starters and stopers.

Example:

[scar]
{ Test
Test
}

// Test

(* This comment does not work *)

[/scar]

See, (* and *) and valid comment starter and stopers in SCAR (few people know that) yet they don’t work in the SCAR tags.

Nothing really important, just I comment my scripts with (* and *).
